tagline: Where the Sun God Rides His Chariot
shortDescription: UNESCO World Heritage Sun Temple, an architectural marvel of 13th century India
description: Konark's Sun Temple, designed as a colossal chariot of the Sun God, is one of India's most stunning architectural achievements. The intricately carved wheels, horses, and erotic sculptures tell stories of ancient Odisha. Combine with nearby Chandrabhaga Beach and the artistic villages of Raghurajpur and Pipili for a complete cultural experience.
landscape: Heritage site, Sun Temple, coastal Odisha
seasonNote: Pleasant weather for temple exploration. Konark Dance Festival (December) is spectacular.
keyAttractions: Konark Sun Temple — UNESCO World Heritage, 13th century chariot temple
Chandrabhaga Beach — Pristine beach near temple, sunrise views
Archaeological Museum — Houses temple sculptures and artifacts
Raghurajpur — Traditional Pattachitra painting village
Pipili — Famous for colorful appliqué craft work

itinerary.title: Travel Day
itinerary.plan: Train: Kolkata → Bhubaneswar. Transfer to Konark/Puri. Evening beach walk.

itinerary.title: Sun Temple Day
itinerary.plan: Konark Sun Temple exploration + Archaeological Museum + Chandrabhaga Beach sunset

itinerary.title: Coastal Morning
itinerary.plan: Ramachandi Temple + Beleswar Beach + sunrise photography + local seafood

itinerary.title: Puri Excursion
itinerary.plan: Day trip to Puri — Jagannath Temple darshan + Puri beach + evening aarti

itinerary.title: Art Villages
itinerary.plan: Pipili appliqué craft village + Raghurajpur Pattachitra artists + Dhauli Peace Pagoda

itinerary.title: Bhubaneswar Temples
itinerary.plan: Lingaraj Temple + Rajarani Temple + Udayagiri-Khandagiri caves + local markets

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.plan: Morning temple visit + Train: Bhubaneswar → Kolkata

bookingTips: Stay in Puri (more options) and day-trip to Konark (35 km)
Konark Dance Festival (December) features classical dance performances
Visit Sun Temple early morning for best light and fewer crowds
Buy Pattachitra art directly from Raghurajpur artists for authenticity
Combine with Puri trip for complete Odisha coastal experience

shortDescription: Cultural island sanctuary of Vaishnavite monasteries and Assamese heritage
description: Majuli, the world's largest river island, floats on the mighty Brahmaputra. This UNESCO-nominated cultural landscape preserves neo-Vaishnavite monasteries (satras), traditional mask-making, and the unique Mishing tribal culture. Cycle through emerald paddy fields, witness centuries-old dance forms, and experience Assam's spiritual heart.
landscape: World's largest river island, Vaishnavite satras, Assamese culture
seasonNote: Avoid monsoon (June–September) due to flooding. Raas Mahotsav (November) is spectacular.
keyAttractions: Satras — Neo-Vaishnavite monasteries (Auniati, Kamalabari, Dakhinpat)
Mask Making — Traditional craft for Raas festival performances
Mishing Villages — Tribal stilt houses (Chang ghars), unique culture
Brahmaputra Sunset — Magical river views and peaceful ambiance
Traditional Weaving — Handloom textiles and Assamese crafts

itinerary.title: Travel Day
itinerary.plan: Train/Flight: Kolkata → Jorhat. Rest overnight in Jorhat.

itinerary.title: Island Arrival
itinerary.plan: Ferry to Majuli (1-2 hours) + explore Kamalabari area + evening satra visit

itinerary.title: Satra Circuit
itinerary.plan: Auniati Satra + Dakhinpat Satra + traditional mask making demonstration

itinerary.title: Village Cycling
itinerary.plan: Cycle through villages + paddy fields + Mishing tribal village + sunset by river

itinerary.title: Culture Day
itinerary.plan: Garmur Satra + pottery village + traditional weaving center + local cuisine

itinerary.title: Nature & Crafts
itinerary.plan: Bird watching at wetlands + Tengapania + handicraft shopping + farewell dinner

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.plan: Morning ferry to Jorhat → Train/Flight to Kolkata

bookingTips: Ferry timings depend on water levels — check locally before travel
Bicycle is the best and most authentic way to explore the island
Visit during Raas Mahotsav (November) for spectacular mask dances
Stay in traditional Chang ghar (stilt houses) for authentic experience
Carry cash — very limited ATMs on the island

shortDescription: Historic coronation site and trekking base for Sikkim's highest peaks
description: Yuksom, Sikkim's first capital, is where the first Chogyal was crowned in 1642. This peaceful village serves as the gateway to the legendary Goecha La trek offering Kanchenjunga views. Explore Sikkim's oldest monastery, trek through rhododendron forests, and experience the authentic Sikkimese culture in this offbeat Himalayan gem.
landscape: Gateway to Kanchenjunga, forest trails, Buddhist heritage
permits: ILP required for certain areas (apply at Rangpo/Gangtok)
bestSeason: March to May, October to November
seasonNote: Spring has rhododendron blooms. Autumn offers clear mountain views. Monsoon has heavy rains.
keyAttractions: Dubdi Monastery — Sikkim's oldest monastery (1701), hilltop trek
Norbugang Coronation Throne — Where first Sikkimese king was crowned
Goecha La Trek — Gateway to spectacular Kanchenjunga views
Khecheopalri Lake — Sacred wish-fulfilling lake
Tashiding Monastery — One of Sikkim's holiest monasteries

itinerary.title: Travel Day
itinerary.plan: Train: Kolkata → NJP. Shared taxi to Pelling/Yuksom (6-7 hours). Evening rest.

itinerary.title: Pelling Sights
itinerary.plan: Pemayangtse Monastery + Rabdentse ruins + Kanchenjunga viewpoint → drive to Yuksom

itinerary.title: Yuksom Heritage
itinerary.plan: Dubdi Monastery trek + Norbugang Coronation Throne + Kathok Lake + village walk

itinerary.title: Forest Trek
itinerary.plan: Day trek toward Sachen (Dzongri trail start) + forest exploration + wildlife spotting

itinerary.title: Monastery Day
itinerary.plan: Day trip to Tashiding Monastery + prayer wheels + local culture immersion

itinerary.title: Sacred Lake
itinerary.plan: Khecheopalri Lake visit + Rimbi Waterfalls + return to Pelling

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.plan: Pelling/Geyzing → NJP → Train to Kolkata

bookingTips: Perfect base for Goecha La trek (needs 8-10 extra days with permits)
Homestays offer authentic Sikkimese experience and warm hospitality
Carry warm clothes — temperatures drop significantly even in summer
Book shared taxis from NJP in advance during peak season
Try local Sikkimese thukpa, momos, and chang (millet beer)

shortDescription: Pioneering conservation village with rich Angami Naga warrior heritage
description: Khonoma, India's first green village, is a remarkable story of conservation and warrior heritage. This Angami Naga village, which fiercely resisted British rule, now protects its forests through a self-imposed hunting ban. Walk through terraced paddy fields, witness traditional Naga craftsmanship, and experience a living culture unchanged for centuries.
landscape: Green village, terraced fields, Angami Naga heritage
permits: Usually not required for Indian citizens; carry ID
seasonNote: Hornbill Festival (December) in nearby Kohima is a cultural highlight. Monsoons have heavy rainfall.
keyAttractions: Khonoma Village — India's first green village, conservation model
Dzuleke Village — Pristine forests and community conservation
Angami Heritage — Traditional Naga houses, morung (community halls)
Tragopan Trail — Bird watching for rare Blyth's Tragopan
Kohima — WWII War Cemetery, Hornbill Festival venue

itinerary.title: Travel Day
itinerary.plan: Flight/Train: Kolkata → Dimapur. Shared taxi to Kohima (3 hours). Evening rest.

itinerary.title: Kohima Sights
itinerary.plan: Kohima War Cemetery + State Museum + Kohima Village + drive to Khonoma (20 km)

itinerary.title: Village Immersion
itinerary.plan: Khonoma village walks + conservation trails + traditional house visits + birdwatching

itinerary.title: Dzuleke Trek
itinerary.plan: Trek to Dzuleke village + pristine forest exploration + Puliebadze Peak views

itinerary.title: Culture Day
itinerary.plan: Naga handicrafts + traditional weaving + local meals with village elders + stories

itinerary.title: Return Journey
itinerary.plan: Khonoma → Kohima exploration → Dimapur (evening)

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.plan: Flight/Train: Dimapur → Kolkata

bookingTips: Visit during Hornbill Festival (December) in Kohima for incredible cultural experience
Book homestays directly with village community for authentic stay
Carry cash and basic medicines — very limited facilities
Respect local customs — seek permission before photographing people
Try authentic Naga cuisine — smoked pork, axone (fermented soybean)

shortDescription: UNESCO-nominated tribal valley with emerald rice terraces and unique culture
description: Ziro Valley, a UNESCO World Heritage tentative site, is home to the fascinating Apatani tribe known for their sustainable rice-fish farming and distinctive facial tattoos. The valley's emerald paddy fields, pine-covered hills, and living tribal traditions create an experience unlike anywhere else in India. Visit during Ziro Music Festival for indie music magic.
landscape: Emerald rice fields, pine groves, Apatani tribal villages
permits: Inner Line Permit (ILP) REQUIRED — Apply online at arunachalilp.com
seasonNote: Ziro Music Festival (late September) is legendary. Monsoons are lush but roads can be tricky.
keyAttractions: Apatani Villages — Hong, Hari, Bulla with traditional bamboo houses
Rice Terraces — Stunning paddy fields with fish cultivation
Ziro Music Festival — India's most scenic outdoor music festival
Talley Valley Wildlife Sanctuary — Pristine forests, rare species
Pine Groves — Beautiful walking trails through fragrant forests

itinerary.title: Travel Day
itinerary.plan: Flight: Kolkata → Guwahati. Rest overnight or start road journey.

itinerary.title: Road Journey
itinerary.plan: Road: Guwahati → Naharlagun/Itanagar (overnight stop)

itinerary.title: Ziro Arrival
itinerary.plan: Road: Naharlagun → Ziro (5 hours). Check-in. Evening valley walk.

itinerary.title: Village Exploration
itinerary.plan: Hong village + Hari village + Apatani culture + rice terrace walks + craft visits

itinerary.title: Nature Day
itinerary.plan: Valley viewpoints + pine forest treks + Talley Valley edge + sunset

itinerary.title: Cultural Exchange
itinerary.plan: Local festivals (if any) + traditional weaving + community interactions + markets

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.plan: Return road to Guwahati → Flight to Kolkata

bookingTips: Apply for ILP online before travel — carry printed copy always
Book early during Ziro Music Festival (September) — accommodations fill fast
Road journey is long but scenic — consider overnight stop at Itanagar
Respect Apatani customs — ask before photographing tattooed elders
Try Apatani cuisine — rice beer, smoked meat, bamboo shoot dishes

shortDescription: Crystal-clear trout streams flowing through pristine Himalayan wilderness
description: Tirthan Valley, gateway to the Great Himalayan National Park (UNESCO World Heritage), offers the serenity that Manali once had. Crystal-clear rivers teeming with trout, forested trails, and charming riverside homestays create the perfect mountain escape. Trek to Serolsar Lake, cross Jalori Pass, or simply sit by the river with a book.
landscape: River valley, trout streams, Great Himalayan National Park
permits: GHNP entry permit required for treks inside park
bestSeason: March to June, September to November
seasonNote: Spring and autumn are ideal. Monsoons have leeches on trails. Winters are cold but beautiful.
keyAttractions: Tirthan River — Crystal clear trout streams, fishing paradise
Great Himalayan National Park — UNESCO World Heritage, diverse wildlife
Jalori Pass — High altitude pass (3,120m) with panoramic views
Serolsar Lake — Sacred lake trek through oak and rhododendron forests
Jibhi — Charming hamlet with waterfalls and cafés

itinerary.title: Travel Day
itinerary.plan: Train: Kolkata → Chandigarh (overnight). Or fly to Delhi + bus.

itinerary.title: Valley Arrival
itinerary.plan: Road: Chandigarh → Tirthan Valley (7 hours). Evening riverside walk.

itinerary.title: Lake Trek
itinerary.plan: Jalori Pass + Serolsar Lake trek (12 km round trip) + mountain views

itinerary.title: Park Exploration
itinerary.plan: Great Himalayan National Park entrance trek + Tirthan river fishing

itinerary.title: Fort Trek
itinerary.plan: Raghupur Fort trek from Jalori Pass + village exploration + local culture

itinerary.title: River Day
itinerary.plan: Riverside relaxation + Jibhi waterfalls + trout fishing + local craft shopping

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.plan: Tirthan → Chandigarh → Train/Flight to Kolkata

bookingTips: Riverside homestays offer the best experience — book directly
Book GHNP permits in advance for deep forest treks (3+ days)
Trout fishing requires permit (₹200–500) — catch and release encouraged
Carry warm layers — valley temperatures drop quickly in evenings
Try fresh river trout at local dhabas — a Tirthan specialty

shortDescription: Alpine meadows leading to the world's highest Shiva temple
description: Chopta, at 2,680m, is a tiny hamlet surrounded by alpine meadows and dense rhododendron forests. It's the base for the spectacular Tungnath-Chandrashila trek — leading to the world's highest Shiva temple and 360-degree Himalayan panoramas. For trekkers seeking both spirituality and adventure, Chopta delivers magic without the crowds.
landscape: Alpine meadows, Tungnath temple, Chandrashila peak
bestSeason: March to June, September to November
seasonNote: Spring has rhododendron blooms. Autumn offers clear Himalayan views. Winter has heavy snow.
keyAttractions: Tungnath Temple — World's highest Shiva temple (3,680m)
Chandrashila Peak — 360° Himalayan panorama at 4,000m
Deoria Tal — Pristine high-altitude lake reflecting mountains
Alpine Bugyals — Rolling meadows with wildflowers
Kedarnath Wildlife Sanctuary — Rich birdlife and wildlife

itinerary.title: Travel Day
itinerary.plan: Train: Kolkata → Haridwar (overnight). Or fly to Dehradun + car.

itinerary.title: Road to Chopta
itinerary.plan: Road: Haridwar → Chopta via Rishikesh, Devprayag (8 hours). Evening meadow walk.

itinerary.title: Tungnath Trek
itinerary.plan: Trek to Tungnath temple (3.5 km) + continue to Chandrashila summit (1.5 km) for sunrise/sunset

itinerary.title: Deoria Tal
itinerary.plan: Trek to Deoria Tal lake from Sari village (3 km) + camping/picnic + return

itinerary.title: Village Exploration
itinerary.plan: Explore Sari village + Rohini Bugyal meadows + local culture + birding

itinerary.title: Leisure Day
itinerary.plan: Buffer day for weather / Kedarnath Wildlife Sanctuary birding / meadow relaxation

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.plan: Chopta → Haridwar → Train/Flight to Kolkata

bookingTips: Winter (December–February) has heavy snow — trek routes may be closed
Carry warm clothes even in summer — temperatures drop at night
Start Chandrashila trek early (4-5 AM) for sunrise at summit
Camping gear available for rent locally at Chopta
Carry your own snacks — limited shops along trek routes

shortDescription: Hill station with pine forests, coffee plantations, and tribal culture
description: Daringbadi, known as the 'Kashmir of Odisha,' is the state's only hill station that experiences snowfall. At 915m, it offers a refreshing escape with pine forests, coffee and pepper plantations, and the unique culture of the Kondh tribes. Waterfalls, nature parks, and undiscovered trails make this an offbeat gem for nature lovers.
landscape: Hills, pine forests, waterfalls, coffee plantations
seasonNote: Pleasant cool weather. Monsoons create lush greenery but roads can be tricky. Winter may have light frost.
keyAttractions: Hill View Point — Panoramic valley and forest views
Midubanda Waterfalls — Scenic multi-tiered cascade
Coffee & Pepper Plantations — Unique to Odisha hills
Kondh Tribal Villages — Authentic tribal culture and crafts
Belghar Nature Camp — Wildlife and forest trekking

itinerary.title: Travel Day
itinerary.plan: Train: Kolkata → Berhampur. Shared taxi to Daringbadi (4 hours). Evening rest.

itinerary.title: Nature Introduction
itinerary.plan: Nature Park + Hill View Point + pine forest walks + Daringbadi market

itinerary.title: Waterfalls Day
itinerary.plan: Midubanda Waterfalls + coffee/pepper plantation tour + local products shopping

itinerary.title: Cultural Immersion
itinerary.plan: Lovers' Point + Doluri River + Kondh tribal village visit + traditional crafts

itinerary.title: Forest Trek
itinerary.plan: Putudi Waterfalls trek + pine forest exploration + nature photography

itinerary.title: Wildlife & Leisure
itinerary.plan: Belghar Nature Camp + birdwatching + local markets + relaxation

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.plan: Daringbadi → Berhampur → Train to Kolkata

bookingTips: One of the few places in Odisha to experience frost/light snow
Visit during winter (December–January) for coldest weather
Limited ATMs — carry sufficient cash
Buy local coffee and pepper directly from plantations
Respect Kondh tribal customs — seek permission before photographing

shortDescription: India's largest Buddhist monastery amidst snow-capped Himalayan peaks
description: Tawang, perched at 3,048m, is home to India's largest Buddhist monastery and the birthplace of the 6th Dalai Lama. The journey through Sela Pass (4,170m), past frozen lakes and snow-clad peaks, is as magical as the destination. Experience Monpa tribal culture, WWII history, and pristine alpine landscapes in this remote Himalayan sanctuary.
landscape: Alpine mountains, Buddhist culture, snow-clad passes
permits: Inner Line Permit (ILP) REQUIRED — Apply online at arunachalilp.com
bestSeason: March to June, September to October
seasonNote: Spring and autumn are best. Winter has heavy snow; roads may close. Losar festival (February) is special.
keyAttractions: Tawang Monastery — India's largest Buddhist monastery (400+ years old)
Sela Pass — High altitude pass (4,170m) with frozen lakes
Madhuri Lake (Sangetsar) — Stunning glacial lake near China border
Tawang War Memorial — Honoring 1962 Indo-China war heroes
Bumla Pass — India-China border point (permit required)

itinerary.title: Travel Day
itinerary.plan: Flight: Kolkata → Guwahati. Overnight rest in Guwahati.

itinerary.title: Road to Dirang
itinerary.plan: Road: Guwahati → Bomdila/Dirang (8-10 hours). Evening monastery visit.

itinerary.title: Tawang Arrival
itinerary.plan: Road: Dirang → Tawang via Sela Pass (6 hours). Sela Lake photo stop. Evening monastery.

itinerary.title: Tawang Exploration
itinerary.plan: Tawang Monastery + War Memorial + local markets + Craft Centre + Ani Gompa

itinerary.title: Bumla & Lakes
itinerary.plan: Bumla Pass excursion (if permitted) + Madhuri Lake (Sangetsar) + PTSO Lake

itinerary.title: Return Journey
itinerary.plan: Tawang → Bomdila/Dirang (overnight). Visit Bomdila Monastery.

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.plan: Road: Bomdila → Guwahati → Flight to Kolkata

bookingTips: Apply for ILP online before travel — many tour operators include this
Bumla Pass requires additional Protected Area Permit — arrange through tour operator
Carry altitude sickness medication — acclimatize properly at Dirang
Roads can be challenging — book experienced drivers through reputed agencies
Visit during Losar (Tibetan New Year, February) for unique cultural experience

shortDescription: High-altitude cold desert with ancient monasteries and moonscape terrain
description: Spiti Valley, meaning 'The Middle Land,' is a cold desert mountain valley at 4,270m that feels like another planet. Ancient monasteries perch on cliffs, fossil-rich villages dot the moonscape, and the highest post office in the world awaits your letter. This is raw, rugged Himalayan adventure for those seeking the road less traveled.
landscape: High-altitude cold desert, rugged mountains, ancient monasteries
permits: Not required for most areas (Inner Line Permit for certain border areas)
seasonNote: Roads open only in summer. Rohtang and Kunzum passes close in winter. June–September has clear skies.
keyAttractions: Key Monastery — Iconic 1,000-year-old monastery on hilltop
Chandratal Lake — Crescent-shaped high-altitude lake (4,300m)
Komic & Langza — Highest villages with Buddha statue and fossils
Hikkim — World's highest post office
Pin Valley — Snow leopard habitat, Pin Valley National Park

itinerary.title: Travel Day
itinerary.plan: Flight: Kolkata → Delhi/Chandigarh. Overnight rest or start road journey.

itinerary.title: Shimla Route
itinerary.plan: Road: Chandigarh → Shimla → Narkanda (6-7 hours). Acclimatization.

itinerary.title: Kinnaur Entry
itinerary.plan: Road: Narkanda → Sangla → Kalpa (7 hours). Kinnaur Kailash views.

itinerary.title: Into Spiti
itinerary.plan: Road: Kalpa → Nako → Tabo (7 hours). Tabo Monastery (1,000+ years old).

itinerary.title: Kaza Exploration
itinerary.plan: Road: Tabo → Dhankar → Kaza. Dhankar Monastery + Key Monastery.

itinerary.title: Highest Villages
itinerary.plan: Komic (highest village) + Langza (Buddha statue) + Hikkim (highest post office) + Pin Valley

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.plan: Return via Manali (if Rohtang open) or reverse route to Chandigarh → Flight to Kolkata

bookingTips: Roads open only May–October — check pass status before travel
Acclimatize properly — altitude sickness is real at 4,000m+
Multi-day driving needs rest stops — don't rush the journey
Homestays in villages offer authentic experience and support locals
Carry Diamox for altitude sickness and plenty of warm layers
